intro: Ionidium dahomensis, commonly known as the Dahomey ionidium, is a rare flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
